perceive.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to understand or think of something or someone in a particular way
perceive.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Even as a young woman she had been perceived as a future chief executive.
Often what is perceived to be aggression is simply fear.
Children who do badly in school tests often perceive themselves to be failures.
perceive.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to notice, see, or recognize something
perceive.translation[0].definitions[1].e: That morning, he perceived a change in Francaâ€™s mood.
Cats are not able to perceive colour.
He perceived that there was no other way out of the crisis.
perceive.translation[0].note_box[0].item: Perceive is not used in the progressive You say
I am perceiving a slight difference
